body_html:
This op (and some other ops under tf.contrib) is not supported under windows cmake build yet. Unfortunately, there is no simple work around. But if you are able to build tensorflow from source, you can add command to tf_python.cmake for tf.contrib.memory_stats like this (as tensorflow/models#2511 (comment) suggests):

tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_python.cmake

Lines 604 to 640 in e210cb1

if(WIN32)
# include contrib/rnn as .so
#
set(tf_gru_srcs
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/blas_gemm.cc"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/blas_gemm.h"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/gru_ops.cc"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/gru_ops.h"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/ops/gru_ops.cc"
)
set(tf_gru_gpu_srcs
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/gru_ops_gpu.cu.cc"
)
set(tf_lstm_srcs
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/blas_gemm.cc"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/blas_gemm.h"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/lstm_ops.cc"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/lstm_ops.h"
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/ops/lstm_ops.cc"
)
set(tf_lstm_gpu_srcs
"${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/lstm_ops_gpu.cu.cc"
)
AddUserOps(TARGET _gru_ops
SOURCES "${tf_gru_srcs}"
GPUSOURCES ${tf_gru_gpu_srcs}
DEPENDS pywrap_tensorflow_internal tf_python_ops
DISTCOPY ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/tf_python/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/)
AddUserOps(TARGET _lstm_ops
SOURCES "${tf_lstm_srcs}"
GPUSOURCES ${tf_lstm_gpu_srcs}
DEPENDS pywrap_tensorflow_internal tf_python_ops
DISTCOPY ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/tf_python/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/)
endif(WIN32)

Then rebuild it may work (not tested).

For most users this is not an easy job and should be done by the developers who are familiar with windows cmake build.

This op (and some other ops under tf.contrib) is not supported under windows cmake build yet. Unfortunately, there is no simple work around. But if you are able to build tensorflow from source, you can add command to tf_python.cmake for tf.contrib.memory_stats like this (as tensorflow/models#2511 (comment) suggests):

  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_python.cmake

                   "${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/lstm_ops.cc" 
        

        
          
                   "${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/lstm_ops.h" 
        

        
          
                   "${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/ops/lstm_ops.cc" 
        

        
          
               ) 
        

        
          
               set(tf_lstm_gpu_srcs 
        

        
          
                   "${tensorflow_source_dir}/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/kernels/lstm_ops_gpu.cu.cc" 
        

        
          
               ) 
        

        
          
            
        

        
          
               AddUserOps(TARGET _gru_ops 
        

        
          
                   SOURCES "${tf_gru_srcs}"

                   DEPENDS pywrap_tensorflow_internal tf_python_ops 
        

        
          
                   DISTCOPY ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/tf_python/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/) 
        

        
          
            
        

        
          
               AddUserOps(TARGET _lstm_ops 
        

        
          
                   SOURCES "${tf_lstm_srcs}" 
        

        
          
                   GPUSOURCES ${tf_lstm_gpu_srcs} 
        

        
          
                   DEPENDS pywrap_tensorflow_internal tf_python_ops 
        

        
          
                   DISTCOPY ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/tf_python/tensorflow/contrib/rnn/python/ops/) 
        

        
          
           endif(WIN32) 
        
    
  


Then rebuild it may work (not tested).
For most users this is not an easy job and should be done by the developers who are familiar with windows cmake build.
body:
This op (and some other ops under `tf.contrib`) is not supported under windows cmake build yet. Unfortunately, there is no simple work around. But if you are able to build tensorflow from source, you can add command to `tf_python.cmake` for `tf.contrib.memory_stats` like this (as https://github.com/tensorflow/models/issues/2511#issuecomment-335279353 suggests):
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/e210cb140a60a74d5e9ce3bf9ebedb21b4910f1c/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_python.cmake#L604-L640
Then rebuild it may work (not tested).

For most users this is not an easy job and should be done by the developers who are familiar with windows cmake build.
